Given <math display="inline">z \in \mathbb{C}</math> <math display="inline">\operatorname{arg}\left( z \right)</math> is equal to the angle bertween the positive real axis and the line joining the point to the origin. Note many different angles give rise to the same complex number, so we define <math display="inline">\operatorname{Arg}\left( z \right)</math> to be the unique value of the argument that lies within the interval <math display="inline">\left( -\pi, \pi \right]</math>
